section.title: Overview
section.para: itself requires very low effort in terms of maintenance, mostly relying on the application server administrative features.

All application logs are generated in a unique specific output file, conforming to the naming conventions presented here. You may also refer to the annex that lists the errors trapped, together with a set of proposed actions that the system administrator should undertake when encountering them.

section.title: Traces Format
section.para: All messages raised in the log file follow the following format:
[Date] -- ERROR -- Module + ' - ' + Description + Additional error traces eventually concatenated.
section.programlisting: [lun. d√©c. 02 12:51:51 CET] -- ERROR -- com.neomalogic.gtp.common.localization.Localization - Id is f071ccea-0a0a0a05-01a5ba75-0a302324, message is :ORACLE ERROR 345 Impossible to connect to database.

section.title: Error Number Format
section.para: The Error Number is a unique ID split in 4 sections of 8 characters.

section.title: Error Message Display
section.para: When encounters an error, an error message with a unique ID is displayed to offer maximum hints about it, so that he can eventually contact to the technical administrator.
The message format is almost identical to the traces' one, though it is displayed with three lines.

note.para: The first line shows a localised message meaningful to the user, whereas the others lines are understandable to the technical administrator.
